title: Winpe vs Dos network boot disk

forumNotes.author: paul vickers
forumNotes.content:
Hi  

I haven't been on Bootland for a while as i didn't really see the avantages 32 bit winpe boot did for me compared to just using a dos network boot disk  

My job require me to provide a service that allow users to load ghost images of many different PC models over the network. To do this i have implemented TFTP32, Pxelinux and Bart network boot disk to connect to a file server which run a menu (cmd file) that allow the user anywhere to select the ghost image he wants.  

A couple of year ago i looked into winpe to replace dos (Bart network boot disk) however the 100mb wim file downloading over the network made advantage of using ghost 32 seem pointless as the quick load time via ghost was overshadowed with length time actually connect to the server through winpe.  

However a couple of year has past and i wondering if anyone can tell me if is worth considering again to replace dos element of my process.

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
Assuming using win7 WinPE v3 Advantages: 1. Easy to plug in win7 net driver (just call 'drvload myinf.inf') 2. Availability of win7 drivers better than DOS driver 3. Faster hard disk access - DOS uses BIOS which is often slow, winPE uses DMA driver so is much faster. Ghost32 will be much faster at disk access than Ghost on some systems which do not have DMA support in BIOS int13h. 4. Easy access to NTFS filesystem if required 5. Supports .hta files so can make a 'web' menu GUI. Disadvantages: 1. Win 7/Vista drivers may not be available for older systems 2. Need 512MB RAM 3. Need to load 150MB via PXE initially 4. WinPE v3 takes a while to load and initialise (but faster than WinPE v2).
I use a \\DRIVERS folder on a USB pen. When WinPE boots, it DRVLOADS all NIC drivers under the \\DRIVERS folder. So if I have new xxx h/w, I just drop the new Win7 driver into the \\DRIVERS\\xxx folder on my USB pen and job done!

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
> However a couple of year has past and i wondering if anyone can tell me if is worth considering again to replace dos element of my process.
The decision is entirely up to you ![:unsure:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/unsure.png), but the point that you might have missed (and that most of boot-land members have also lost as an objective, expecially now that Gbytes are cheap ![:unsure:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/unsure.png)) is that **minimal** PE builds are possible.  

So, whilst it is obviously pointless to transfer over the network something you won't ever need, making a "tuned" minimal version of a PE (and/or a "modular" one) BARELY capapble of ONLY running a given app is NOT a bad idea.  

The **trend** is now instead that of creating BLOATed PE's, i.e. PE's that are replicas of FULL installs, just for the sake of having a stoopid program you won't use or .net based in the PE, or Explore as shell (because I like it :smile:) also.  

AFAIK/AFAICR a couple of years ago there weren't any .wim based builds (if NOT Vista ![:mellow:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/mellow.png)) based, and definitely no BartPE ones, I wonder what have you looked at. ![:mellow:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/mellow.png)  

Just for your interest, and NOT necessarily of immediate use (or of ANY use at all):  
[http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=3717](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=3717 "External link")  
[http://www.911cd.net...showtopic=16528](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?showtopic=16528 "External link")  
[http://z3.invisionfr...php?showforum=3](http://z3.invisionfree.com/Boot_Land/index.php?showforum=3 "External link")  
[http://www.911cd.net...showtopic=12067](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?showtopic=12067 "External link")  

Something in the 20รท35 Mb size range (uncompressed) is possible and it is not that slow over network, expecially if you take into account the new developments of RAMDISK drivers and loaders (you can transfer a compressed image). ![:mellow:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/mellow.png)  

:smile:  
Wonko

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
> apologies if this is in the links supplied as i have not gone through them yet

Apologies accepted. ![:mellow:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/mellow.png)  

Those are just ideas or "starting points". you'll have to do your own experiments/attempts.  

The smallest Registry and txtsetup.sif ever seen on a PE 1.x are those by draugen, and as well the smallest "real" XP build is the XPCLI originated by Dietmar (given links).  
I am not too happy using basically NT 6.x technology (.wim format) on a PE 1.x build, there are other simpler ways:  
[http://www.911cd.net...showtopic=23497](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?showtopic=23497 "External link")  
(and yes, the .wim compression is a very good one)  

The approach I am suggesting is a bit different from the "standard" everyone uses.  
If the problem is to run a limited number of programs on a limited numbers of machines, and given that the network server can store a numebr of different minimal PE's (same occupied size for 20 of them as a couple of "normal" PE builds do), I would make a number of "super-specialized" minimal builds able to run (and with dirvers integrated) on a certain PC or set of similar PC's.  
When you need to work on PC belongng (hardware similarity) to group A, you load from network image "A", if working on PC "B", image "B" and so on.  
Since the amount of actually \*needed\* specialized drivers are probably just the network and (but not entirely \*needed\*) SATA ones, it should be trivial, once made the "base" image to create the other ones. (I don't think that in order to run a command line app or even a semi-graphical GUI one you really need a high resolution or high number of colours for your monitor, nor audio).  

For a first test of a little PE 1.x, use this old thingy:  
[http://www.911cd.net...showtopic=16543](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?showtopic=16543 "External link")  
[http://hooovahh.goog...m/BartAIO1.4.7z](http://hooovahh.googlepages.com/BartAIO1.4.7z "External link")  

Check also the OLD (good) native_ex projects:  
[http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=4696](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/?showtopic=4696 "External link")  
PicoXP would be a good starting point (if using Winbuilder).  

![:mellow:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/mellow.png)  
Wonko
